tiles.name: Polar Bears
tiles.description: See polar bears on the arctic tundra before they head out onto the ice for winter

tiles.name: Food trucks
tiles.description: JapaDog’s famous hotdogs were the original innovators in Vancouver’s now thriving fusion food truck scene

tiles.name: Foraging
tiles.description: Foraging in Newfoundland and Labrador is a year-round affair, from summer’s bakeapples, to autumn’s amazing variety of mushrooms
tiles.imgAlt: plate of foraged mushrooms and spring onions

tiles.name: Montreal Jazz festival
tiles.description: Chill with some of the coolest cats in jazz at Montreal’s world-renowned international festival

tiles.name: Shellfish festival
tiles.description: Oyster-shuckers and chowder champions sharpen their knives at P.E.I.’s annual Shellfish Festival

tiles.name: White water rafting
tiles.description: The mountains of Alberta and B.C. offer some of Canada’s best whitewater rafting
tiles.imgAlt: point of view from raft on river

tiles.name: First nations
tiles.description: Discover the rich history and cultural influence of Canada’s First Nations

tiles.name: Lobster
tiles.description: Fresh, sustainable lobster are caught, served and celebrated across the four Atlantic provinces

tiles.name: Calgary stampede
tiles.description: Hitch your wagons and roll on up to the world-famous Calgary Stampede
tiles.imgAlt: back of man looking on at stampede

tiles.name: Moose safari
tiles.description: For an excellent chance of sighting moose, take a canoe trip in Algonquin provincial park

tiles.name: Spirit bear
tiles.description: Spirit, or Kermode, bears are a rare white subspecies of the more common black bear

tiles.name: Icebergs
tiles.description: Iceberg Alley offers the chance to view 10,000-year-old sparkling giants
tiles.imgAlt: man looking out to iceberg in sea

tiles.name: Grizzly bears
tiles.description: Grizzlies are found across western Canada – the largest population is in the Great Bear rainforest on the west coast

tiles.name: Canoeing
tiles.description: Canada contains more lakes and inland waters than any other country in the world, making it the perfect place to canoe

tiles.name: Ranch life
tiles.description: The historic Reesor ranch offers a taste of what life was really like for Canada’s prairie pioneers

tiles.name: Salmon snorkelling
tiles.description: Snorkel with thousands of salmon returning to spawn in the pristine waters of the Campbell river

tiles.name: Northern Lights
tiles.description: Northern Canada's winter night skies play host to the breathtaking aurora borealis

tiles.name: Toronto International Film Festival
tiles.description: September’s annual Toronto International Film Festival is second only to Cannes in terms of influence
tiles.imgAlt: film stars taking photos before the event

tiles.name: Whales
tiles.description: Canada's west coast is one of the best places in the world to see migrating orca, humpback and grey whales

tiles.name: Wine
tiles.description: Be surprised by Canada's wine-growing regions

tiles.name: Whistler
tiles.description: Whistler Blackcomb, celebrating its 50th year, is the ultimate outdoor resort. It boasts over 8,000 acres of terrain for winter snowsports and summer activities

tiles.name: Busker Festival
tiles.description: In late July, Halifax’s waterfront plays host to the annual International Busker Festival, with musicians and performance artists from around the world

tiles.name: Sushi
tiles.description: Sustainably sourced sushi is a Vancouver must-have – fresh, beautiful, and delicious

tiles.name: Dark Sky Festival
tiles.description: Viewing the night sky at the annual Jasper Dark Sky festival takes stargazing to an otherworldly level

tiles.name: Beluga whales
tiles.description: The distinctive song of the beluga whale earns them the nickname “canaries of the sea” –  thousands visit Hudson Bay each summer

tiles.name: Top drives in the world - Icefields Parkway
tiles.description: Drive the 144-mile Icefields parkway between Banff and Jasper and discover the dramatic scenery of the Rockies

tiles.name: Tidal range
tiles.description: The Bay of Fundy has the highest tidal range in the world - with more than 100 billion tonnes of seawater flowing in and out of the bay every day

tiles.name: Lodge Life
tiles.description: Coastal, mountain or lakeside, Canada's wilderness resorts offer peace, tranquillity and wildlife viewing experiences like no other
